div.p: I received your letter, venerable man, on the 23rd of April, in which I was informed that it would be advisable, considering the circumstances, to delay the matter of promoting the minister of the church in Betschwanden for a while, until the assembly in Baden, now convened for our sake, is concluded.

You undoubtedly hope that once these are completed, our affairs will be somewhat more favorable and everything will be settled; I feel differently, I fear that the conditions of peace we will receive will be much worse than before, which may the Lord greatly avert.
Therefore, I think it worthwhile that the work of Christ should not be prolonged any further, and that a preacher should be appointed to the church as soon as possible.
For two years now, it has not had its own pastor.
Our enemies are far more vigilant in their affairs than we are, who, without regard to assemblies or councils, continue to faithfully promote the papacy.
Piety will advise us to do the same in the cause of Christ our Lord.

Therefore, I wanted to ask you again, if it can be done, to send us a man who is distinguished by his doctrine and holy way of life, whose family is also honorable, so that a profane life does not destroy what is fittingly good.
He will receive 80 gold coins from the church treasury.
Farewell in the Lord well, who may also deign to prolong your life in the Christian republic. Amen.
Given on the 12th of June, 1563, in Glarus. Fridolin Brunner, minister of the word among the people of Glarus, most observant of you.
To the most illustrious and venerable man, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, most faithful minister of the word of the church in Zurich, my lord and esteemed brother.
